item.title: [Delta] Ultimate Agility Tutorial [3 courses]
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[size=18pt]~ BUGFIX ~[/size]

Bug: When the player is crossing an object he can get stuck.
Example: When the player is crossing a log and clicks in the middle of the log, the player will be stuck on that spot.

Fix:

  1. Open the file where your packets are located, in a normal delta this is the client class.
  2. Search for packet 98 which is the forced walking packet.
    Search:
  1. Add this to the packet:

if (c.getAgilityHandler().isPassing) { return; }

  1. Save and compile, bug fixed. If you find other bugs please let me know.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Ultimate Agility Tutorial [3 courses]
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:24, topic:436841”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=539555.msg3989516#msg3989516 date=1336358596]

Hmm I’m going to have to look around for WalkToEmote. Seems I don’t have it. Now what about the package c does not exist error?

Are you sure you declared it in the client class? (part of the tutorial)
public AgilityCourseShit acc = new AgilityCourseShit(this);
[/quote]

Yes actually I did that this time xD

public class client extends Player implements Runnable {
public static int Waiters = 0;
public int dclaws = 0;
public int pkPoints = 0;
public AgilityHandler handleagility = new AgilityHandler(this);
public AgilityCourses acc = new AgilityCourses(this);

Seems of the like 15 servers I have (only use one. keep others for no reason) only one had the walktoemote, and it was PI so I have no use for it in my delta. do you possibly have it?[/quote]

Here ya go

public void WalkToEmote(int id) {
		playerSEW = id;
	}
	public void StopWalkToEmote() {
		playerSEW = 0x333;
	}

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Ultimate Agility Tutorial [3 courses]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:23, topic:436841”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=539555.msg3989514#msg3989514 date=1336358469]
Hmm I’m going to have to look around for WalkToEmote. Seems I don’t have it. Now what about the package c does not exist error?
[/quote]

Are you sure you declared it in the client class? (part of the tutorial)
public AgilityCourseShit acc = new AgilityCourseShit(this);[/quote]

Yes actually I did that this time xD

public class client extends Player implements Runnable {
public static int Waiters = 0;
public int dclaws = 0;
public int pkPoints = 0;
public AgilityHandler handleagility = new AgilityHandler(this);
public AgilityCourses acc = new AgilityCourses(this);

Seems of the like 15 servers I have (only use one. keep others for no reason) only one had the walktoemote, and it was PI so I have no use for it in my delta. do you possibly have it?

Edit: hopefully i got this in in time.
Found a (stop)walktoemote void that works.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:18, topic:436841”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=539555.msg3989490#msg3989490 date=1336356280]

12 errors
I did add the task system

http://dl.dropbox.com/u/31065410/2.png

use an IDE
[/quote]

Added the wrong pic btw. Damn my dropbox xD
IDE’s don’t like me
Edited above pic.[/quote]

You have to change Client c to client c without capital.
It calls your client class, since yours is probably without a capital you also have to write it without capital here.

Same for Misc you will have to write it without capital, “misc”

“ServerConstants” should be changed to “server”

item.title: [Delta] Ultimate Agility Tutorial [3 courses]
item.dc:creator: @FFkingdom FFkingdom
item.description:
@FFkingdom wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:12, topic:436841”][quote author=FFkingdom link=topic=539555.msg3951260#msg3951260 date=1332295882]

This would be amazing to have especially since I have managed to open all courses but Brimhaven as of now. But whom ever had the client before me removed the class pages to the client side, so I cannot edit anything over there ><. But it looks really good!

Why would you need client side?
That’s only for the ticket system,
you can easily remove it or use something else as currency

Actually what I was setting up was a way in which it would provide X-amount of tickets on the final obstacle in each course, and then have someone allow the trades for the tickets in the proper interface etc. Right now I am working out the means in which you will only get them by going through each course properly. I liked the idea of rewarding for Agility since I am going to be a server where running is constant (HATE walking lmfao) so there would be no means of gaining Agility otherwise. And for some reason no one I have played with in other games likes training Agility. I kind of figured it was because most of these games released only has 2-3 courses completed.
[/quote]
This is what mine does,
it only rewards when completing the course correctly[/quote]
That’s what I meant lol. Like if it were the gnome, you would cross the log, up the net, up the tree, cross the rope, down the tree, over the net, through the pipe and there is where you get the ticket. I almost have it for the werewolf atm, and will be implementing it into the others after I fix my little farming problem lmfao.

Read full topic

Why would you need client side?
That’s only for the ticket system,
you can easily remove it or use something else as currency
[/quote]
Actually what I was setting up was a way in which it would provide X-amount of tickets on the final obstacle in each course, and then have someone allow the trades for the tickets in the proper interface etc. Right now I am working out the means in which you will only get them by going through each course properly. I liked the idea of rewarding for Agility since I am going to be a server where running is constant (HATE walking lmfao) so there would be no means of gaining Agility otherwise. And for some reason no one I have played with in other games likes training Agility. I kind of figured it was because most of these games released only has 2-3 courses completed. :)[/quote]
This is what mine does,
it only rewards when completing the course correctly

item.title: [Delta] Ultimate Agility Tutorial [3 courses]
item.dc:creator: @FFkingdom FFkingdom
item.description:
@FFkingdom wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:10, topic:436841”][quote author=FFkingdom link=topic=539555.msg3951174#msg3951174 date=1332291124]
This would be amazing to have especially since I have managed to open all courses but Brimhaven as of now. But whom ever had the client before me removed the class pages to the client side, so I cannot edit anything over there ><. But it looks really good!
[/quote]
Why would you need client side?
That’s only for the ticket system,
you can easily remove it or use something else as currency[/quote]
Actually what I was setting up was a way in which it would provide X-amount of tickets on the final obstacle in each course, and then have someone allow the trades for the tickets in the proper interface etc. Right now I am working out the means in which you will only get them by going through each course properly. I liked the idea of rewarding for Agility since I am going to be a server where running is constant (HATE walking lmfao) so there would be no means of gaining Agility otherwise. And for some reason no one I have played with in other games likes training Agility. I kind of figured it was because most of these games released only has 2-3 courses completed.

Read full topic
